rationales.universalism: She keeps translating asylum and permit documents so vulnerable families can access critical systems.
rationales.conformity: She resists pressure to limit herself strictly to domestic roles.

rationales.universalism: She rewrites recycling guidance bilingually so immigrant families are not excluded from essential information.
She watches cleanup volunteers but leaves, naming the painful gap between her social commitments and current actions.
She rejects a purely self-focused weekend and centers responsibility to broader social harms.
rationales.hedonism: She dismisses leisure and self-care options in favor of cause-driven usefulness.

rationales.universalism: At the resettlement office she works through backlog forms and flags language gaps for proper follow-up.

rationales.benevolence: She prioritizes direct overnight caregiving for both sick children.
rationales.universalism: Skipping the committee role feels like failing a wider community responsibility she had committed to.
She spends rare free hours drafting a policy letter defending undocumented workers' access to emergency care.
rationales.hedonism: She forgoes rest and recovery to continue advocacy work.

rationales.universalism: She sends the letter and joins river cleanup, taking concrete action for broader welfare and environment.
rationales.self_direction: She proactively restructures family logistics to act on her convictions.

rationales.universalism: She completes the cleanup shift and removes plastic from the river herself.
